title: Yellow City
description:
The Jewel of the old world. City of Topaz, City of Gold, City of Gods, City of Whores. The One city of the slugmen. Encrusted with unkept ancient ruins. City of most refined beauty and sophistication, and yet savage and malicious all the same.

Warehouse, Gate - Party saw a raving woman that screams "Unclean Meat"(which Ugg mugged for ruby bracelet), a little girl obsessed with finding gold and faced a wagon traffic jam caused by slavers kidnapping people as slaves. Frosty initiated the fight and the party managed to defeat the slavers.
New Town - The area where Peaceful runs U-shaped, 5 story 'The Rajput Inn'. The Inn is cheap, yet well guarded. Lizard in every bedroom to kill roaches.
West Docks - West docks area connected to the Topaz Sea. One Huala, a loan officer, by the name of Kayin has an office here.
Market - Market District. There is a tavern here that sells the local liquor by the name of 'Swirling Mud'.
Palace - The Raj. King of the Yellow City lives here. The building is surrounded by a mass of water mile long. Bridge is operated by wizards.
npcs:
Cleatus - A member of a dwarf party.
Siri Iyer - Frosty
Samriel Lockwood - A spellbook thief that Frosty is after. Seems like he doesn't have the book.
Uzoki - Local crime lord and a slaver.
Shrivahn - The adopted prince of the Yellow City.
Peaceful - The owner of Rajput Inn
Jason Greenville - A charmer. Head of the Green River Trading Company.
Henry Rivers - A charmer. Head of the Green River Trading Company.
Kayin - A loan officer. A Huala.

title: Goblin Attack
description: The party faced a goblin party, which the party promptly wiped the floor with.

title: Dead Wife River
description: On the route to Yellow City, party encountered a naked man carrying a drowned womanâ€™s body, a broken raft carrying a man and four children, some screaming priests, and a half drowned woman on the river bank. They save the children, one of whom recites a bizarre nursery rhyme, and continue on their way.

title: Agoha
description: The town that the caravan visited before entering Yasha's Estate.

title: The Tower of Stargazer
description:
Desolate observatory-tower surrounded by lightning from magical disturbance. The tower is fairly small. A mad and powerful wizard by the name of Calsidius resides in it to study different planets in different planes. The said wizard is currently locked up in a magic circle by his head servant.

B2 - there are treasure boxes bounded by Wall of Force and the Prismatic Wall.
B1 - A lab in which Calsidius used to perform necromantic studies.
1 - Waiting room, guest room, entrance.
2 - Servant's quarters, kitchen
3 - The wizard's study. The magic circle in which the wizard is locked in is here.
4 - Library floor. There is a refrigerator too. Ghost guards the path to library with more valueable books.
5 - Observatory of astral planets. Bo, the bard, tragically died by activiating a telescope perfectly well and as a result being thrown into a planet in some other plane resulting in pink goo. He became the food of dancing mushrooms aliens.
npcs:
Uravillon Calsidius - The mad wizard, senile and mad from 59 years of isolation. He is one of the most powerful spellcasters in the world.
Argyle Timmons - Head servant, magic apprentice of Uravillon. Betrayed the wizard and trapped in a 9th level magic circle. Currently left the tower with Uravillon's spell book.

title: The Yasha Estate
description: Peaceful and wealthy farming plantation estate. Extremely well kept and maintained. Grows lavender and wheat. Has 2 giant fireflies for farming.
npcs:
Daisy - Passerby. Invited Teg to the Wild Rose Tea Shop.
Grenzel - Estate Guard
Yasha - Plantation Owner
Ravi - Firefly handler
Gondrick - Estate Guard Captain
The Daughter - Has been 10 year old for 50 years. Will be turning 13 upcoming month.

title: Gurgari
description:
A typical city in a 100 Kingdoms area. Well off and currently rising in power. Has a operation base of a pretty big smuggling ring called the Alliance and a cadre of high nobles titled Zamundar. The city is famous for jewelry, and crops. Six-story buildings, marble sculptures, nobles with face embedded with jewelry show that the kingdom is luxurious and vain. Although adorned in riches, the city is starting to show rot and tear in its society, but for a rising kingdom it seems off.

Temple of the Moth God - The temple of a god served by the people here. Well lit and well guarded.
npcs:
Sau Saj - Pigman Bard. Proficient in small hand percussion and mandolin.
Faizal - Ruler of the kingdom and a Zamundar. Obsessed with self adornment and beauty bordering on madness.
Fae - Faizal's daughter. A devout follower in the Cult of the Elephant Demon.

title: Path to the Swamp
description:
On crossing a bridge over a dry gorge, the party faced a lizardfolk shaman who brought a number of skeletons. The lizardfolk was slain and properly cremated/salted.
There is a cave where rangers of Gurgari frequent. The party was attacked by rats while resting.

title: The Swamp
description: The swamp where the aligator spirit which made a pact with Yasha lives. Was in a deadlock between different entities over the control of the swamp.
npcs:
The Ancient Serpent - Ancient snake creature
Agatha - Night Hag, leader of a coven of green hags. 2 Green hags were slain. She was taking part in controlling the dead gator god. Burned to crisp by Teg.
The Great Gator God - Wears medieval military formal attire, white khakis. Controls catfish. Has a penchant for using presidigitation as parlor tricks. Turns out, the gator god was long dead was impersonated by a hag and a catfish spirit.
Amos - Mercenary fighter. Limbs were amputated and was slain by the party.
Hirugar - Former Ranger. Met with a deity of a forest, became a new man.
Catfish Fiend - Took part in impersonation of the Gator God. Summons lightnings and gator things (undead or not) from varios places. Slain brutally by Marcus.
